attributes.action: Reform the Justice guidlines to allow judges to give longer sentences
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The government needs to reform the criminal justice system and allow judges to give longer and tougher sentences to criminals. Stop crime happening in the fist place rather than, build more prisons.

As a guide a minimum of 5 to 7 years for property crime, 10 to 15 years for crime against a person, 25 to 35 years or life, for murder and terrorism. These sentences would be doubled if it is a second offence or trebled for a third. No parole what so ever. Offenders give up their rights to human rights when they ignore another’s. With a serious and real deterrent, prison occupation will drop, and so will crime. We will not need to build more prisons, and Police will be able to cope on the streets.

Young persistent offenders should get sent to boot camp, or be put into the army.

Older offenders should be made to work in chain gangs in the community.

Prison must be hard time, or it is no deterrent.
